alert.note: Alert for Clinton; Essex (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued September 07 at 2:48PM EDT until September 07 at 3:45PM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: The National Weather Service in Burlington has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southeastern Clinton County in northern New York... Northeastern Essex County in northern New York... Northwestern Addison County in central Vermont... Southern Grand Isle County in northwestern Vermont... Chittenden County in northwestern Vermont... Southwestern Franklin County in northwestern Vermont... * Until 345 PM EDT. * At 248 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Morrisonville to near Willsboro Bay to Moriah, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor hail damage to vehicles is possible. Expect wind damage to trees and powerlines. * Locations impacted include... Essex Junction, Burlington International Airport, Plattsburgh, Plattsburgh International Airport, South Burlington, Burlington, Vergennes, Middlebury, Peru, Beekmantown, Schuyler Falls, Moriah, Willsboro, Westport, Westford, Colchester, Essex Junction Village, Georgia, Addison, and Grand Isle. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: Boaters on Lake Champlain should seek safe harbor now! Strong winds will cause higher waves and sudden wind shifts may overturn boats. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
